title: Template Blueprint Schema
description: Defines the complete structure of a wizard-generated template configuration. This schema represents all 11 wizard steps and enforces validation rules for deterministic template generation.

framework.title: Step 1: Framework Selection
framework.description: CSS framework foundation for the template. Dictates utility classes, component structure, and responsive patterns.
framework.$comment: MCP mapping: sets the LLM role and hard constraints (Tailwind-only vs Bootstrap-only).

category.title: Step 2: Template Category
category.description: Primary use case and content structure. Influences layout patterns and page requirement phrasing.
category.$comment: MCP mapping: becomes the 'Template Category' context header and tunes page requirements (admin vs marketing vs content).

pages.title: Step 3: Page Selection
pages.description: Array of specific pages to include in the template. This list drives MCP page requirements and output file list. Must contain at least one page.
pages.$comment: MCP mapping: produces the explicit page list plus per-page functional requirements and the /src/pages/*.vue output list.

layout.title: Step 4: Layout & Navigation
layout.description: Structural navigation patterns and layout elements.
layout.$comment: MCP mapping: becomes the layout requirements section (navigation pattern, breadcrumbs on/off, footer minimal/full).

sidebarDefaultState.description: Default sidebar state. Only applicable when navigation is 'sidebar' or 'hybrid'.

theme.title: Step 5: Theme & Visual Identity
theme.description: Color scheme and visual mode preferences. These values are translated into MCP instructions for theme tokens and dark/light mode handling.
theme.$comment: MCP mapping: supplies primary/secondary tokens and light/dark default behavior, plus background style requirements.

primary.description: Primary brand color in hex format.

secondary.description: Secondary accent color in hex format.

mode.description: Color mode preference (wizard supports Light/Dark only). Drives MCP requirements for default theme and toggling behavior.

ui.title: Step 6: UI Density & Style
ui.description: Spacing, sizing, and visual weight preferences.
ui.$comment: MCP mapping: translates to concrete spacing/padding defaults and border radius utility usage.

density.description: Overall spacing and size density level.

components.title: Step 7: Components
components.description: UI components to include in the template. This list becomes explicit MCP component requirements and determines which shared components must be generated.
components.$comment: MCP mapping: for each selected component, MCP includes exact required variants and behavior (modals, dropdown close-on-outside, etc.). Charts implies Chart library selection.

chartLibrary.title: Chart Library (Charts sub-option)
chartLibrary.description: Required when 'charts' is included in components. Determines which library the generated template must use.
chartLibrary.$comment: MCP mapping: tight constraint 'Use ONLY Chart.js' or 'Use ONLY Apache ECharts' when charts are requested.

interaction.title: Step 8: Interaction Level
interaction.description: Animation and interaction richness level. Affects transitions, hover states, and micro-interactions.
interaction.$comment: MCP mapping: sets allowed transitions/animations and their intensity (static/moderate/rich).

responsiveness.title: Step 9: Responsiveness
responsiveness.description: Responsive design approach and optimization priority.
responsiveness.$comment: MCP mapping: defines breakpoint strategy and navigation behavior per screen size.

codeStyle.title: Step 10: Code Preferences
codeStyle.description: Code style and verbosity level in generated output. Affects variable naming, comments, and code structure.
codeStyle.$comment: MCP mapping: instructs verbosity and comment density (clean/minimal vs verbose/explicit vs commented/learning).

outputIntent.title: Step 11: Output Intent
outputIntent.description: Expected maturity level of generated code. Affects error handling, accessibility, and documentation depth.
outputIntent.$comment: MCP mapping: sets depth of implementation (MVP scaffold vs production base vs design system starter).

$comment: This schema is the source of truth for Blueprint validation. Any changes must be synchronized with: 1) wizardState.ts (Vue frontend), 2) McpPromptBuilder.php (Laravel service), 3) Blueprint validation rules (Laravel Form Request), 4) product-instruction.md documentation.
